intro: Ardisia pavonia, commonly known as the red bellflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces bright red berries that are attractive to birds, aiding in seed dispersal. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Ardisia pavonia is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
